question: Two electric charges of -6 pC and +6 μC are placed respectively at two points A and B 1m apart. The electric field is zero at the point:
options: Located in the middle of segment AB
Located outside segment AB at 1m of A
Located outside segment AB at 1m of B

question: The intensity of the current which passes through a circuit for 40 minutes and gives an efficiency of 24100 C is:
A resistance motor powered by a voltage of 220 V and crossed by a current of 10 A has a mechanical power of:
The intensity of the electric force exerted by a charge of -5×10⁻⁶ C on another charge of +10⁻⁵ C separated by a distance of 20 m (K = 9×10⁹ SI Units) is:
The value of the electromotive force induced in a coil of negligible resistance is 4.5 μV. What is the value of the voltage across this coil?
314 m of insulated copper wire with a radius of 1 mm are rolled up in turns around a cylindrical core 10 cm in diameter. The number of turns of this solenoid is:

When a wire potentiometer is used to compare two electromotive forces (emf), good experimental techniques include: 1) Verification of wire uniformity, 2) Use of a very sensitive current measuring instrument, 3) Always checking the constant current through the wire.
The corpuscular character of light is demonstrated experimentally by:
If the 234,90 Th atomic nucleus emits a β particle, the resulting nucleus will contain:
Photoelectric emission is:
options: Independent of the frequency of the light radiation
Independent of the threshold frequency of the metal

question: For a given light-emitting cell, which of the following is correct?
options: The electrical current output depends on the wavelength of radiation used
The threshold frequency does not depend on the cathode metal but on the anode metal
The threshold frequency depends on the number of photons arriving per second on the cathode
The intensity of the current output is greater when the cell is turned on with visible light than with ultraviolet light

question: When 110,49 In undergoes a positron emission, the nucleus produces:
A radioactive sample of bismuth-210 has an activity of 9.15×10¹³ Bq. On average, how many disintegrations occur per second in this sample?

The activity of a laboratory sample of iodine is 1.85×10⁶ Bq at the time of transmission. On arrival, the activity value is 1.55×10⁶ Bq. Knowing that its half-life is 8.04 days, what was the time to delivery?
The threshold frequency of a photoemissive cell is a function of:
The origin of Laplace’s force is:
The distance between the Earth and the Moon is 384×10³ km and the ratio of their masses is Mₑ/Mₘ = 81.5. The point of equigravity on the axis between the two planets is at:
The resultant force exerted on a solid of mass 5 tons is 4×10⁴ N. The center of gravity of this solid moves with an acceleration of magnitude:
Two steel balls B₁ and B₂ fall from the same horizontal plane at a height of 25 m. B₁ is released without speed while B₂ is launched horizontally at 5 m/s. At time t = 1.5 s:
options: The height of B₁ is greater than that of B₂
The height of B₂ is greater than that of B₁
The heights of the two balls are equal
The magnitudes of the velocities of the two balls are equal

question: A ball is launched from point O on horizontal ground with an inclined speed Vo at an angle α. Neglecting air resistance and assuming the ball is a point mass: During the movement, the acceleration vector:
options: Stays parallel to the flight path and in the same direction
Remains parallel to the flight path but in the opposite direction
Stays perpendicular to the flight path
Changes direction at the top of the trajectory

question: A ball is launched from point O on horizontal ground with an inclined speed Vo at an angle α. Neglecting air resistance and assuming the ball is a point mass: At the top of the trajectory, the speed is:

A ball is launched from point O on horizontal ground with an inclined speed Vo at an angle α. Neglecting air resistance and assuming the ball is a point mass: The height of the trajectory at the top is:
options: Proportional to the square of Vo

question: A ball is launched from point O on horizontal ground with an inclined speed Vo at an angle α. Neglecting air resistance and assuming the ball is a point mass: The duration of the movement of the ball is:
options: Proportional to the square of Vo

question: A star with twice the mass of the sun has a gravitational field of 2.65×10¹² N·kg⁻¹ at its surface. Given: mass of the sun M = 1.99×10³⁰ kg, gravitational constant G = 6.67×10⁻¹¹ SI. The radius of the star is:
The magnitude of the gravitational field due to a solid of mass 7.35×10²² kg at a point located 3.85×10⁸ m away is:
